subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Yeah--it works.
author: juli velazquez
full_text:
--0-1421036228-1202013589=:38698
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Laura I was not being rude at all.  I think that you then of all people know how many people bother him being around so long.  He is a good man (as I am sure you will agree) and I very much dislike some (not namely you) who come running through with other motives in mind!
   
  The board was evident of that 2 weeks ago with the mud be thrown.
   
  Juli

Laura Kimberley <gjk1rrfan@...> wrote:
              Julie, I was not graveling at his feet, and please again refrain from being rude. Frank knows me. I have been here a lot longer than you. Keep up the good work your doing now.
  Laura
  
      From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of juli velazquez
Sent: Saturday, February 02, 2008 10:17 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Yeah--it works.


  
          Laura

               The schematics are on in the folder section.  I would request from the new members please not to beg for boxes, it is actually sickening.  Frank is back for a whole 2 minutes and people are graveling at his feet.

    

    Juli       

    

    

                 

Laura Kimberley <gjk1rrfan@...> wrote:

            Welcome back Frank,

    I have a question for you. You have given boxes all men here in the group except one man has any woman been given the opportunity to have a box? I have requested one for a  long time now and even offered to pay you.

    But if you just send me the schematics I will build it, I am studying electronics now and here in Mexico the random would be a good thing I believe. Because even though  there�s no English speaking stations near me all I get is English J

    Laura

        From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Frank Sumption
Sent: Saturday, February 02, 2008 9:17 PM
To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Yeah--it works.



          
 There is a lack of the background hiss, and white noise of the random tuned systems.
 
 The sweep circuit is simple, and using pre-made tuners a real time saver, provided a source for the older tuners can be found. I used to get them from junk yards, but the old radios are getting harder to find. They have the advantage of all the RF components matching the chip.
 
 Frank-S
